title: Paul Morgan (rugby)
text:
Paul Morgan (3 October 1974 – 12 January 2015) was a Welsh professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer, <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a> and <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er, born in <a href="Pencoed">Pencoed</a>. He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Pencoed%20RFC">Pencoed RFC</a> (two spells), <a href="London%20Welsh%20RFC">London Welsh RFC</a> (while at <a href="Brunel%20University">Brunel University</a>), <a href="Whitland%20RFC">Whitland RFC</a>, <a href="Aberavon%20RFC">Aberavon RFC</a> (two spells), <a href="Llanharan%20RFC">Llanharan RFC</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20Ravens">Bridgend Ravens</a>, <a href="Maesteg%20RFC">Maesteg RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centre">Centre</a>, i.e. number 12 or 13, representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team%20players">Heritage № 432</a>), and at club level for <a href="Neath%20Port%20Talbot%20Steelers">Aberavon Fighting Irish</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20Blue%20Bulls">Bridgend Blue Bulls</a> (two spells), <a href="Crusaders%20Rugby%20League">Celtic Crusaders</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4, coached club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Neath%20Athletic%20RFC">Neath Athletic RFC</a><a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20150113155845/http%3A//www.pitchero.com/clubs/neathathletic"></a>, and <a href="Aberavon%20Quins%20RFC">Aberavon Quins RFC</a>. and played <a href="cricket">cricket</a> for <a href="Pencoed%20Cricket%20Club">Pencoed Cricket Club</a><a href="http%3A//pencoed.play-cricket.com"></a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>).
Background.
Paul Morgan was born in <a href="Pencoed">Pencoed</a>, <a href="Bridgend">Bridgend</a>, Wales, he was the Executive Director at All Sports Protection, having been a Sports Risk Consultant at brightsidegroup, National Manager at April-UK Sports Division, Director at Morgans Health & Fitness Centre, and Gyms Co-ordinator at <a href="Bridgend%20County%20Borough%20Council">Bridgend County Borough Council</a>, he was survived by spouse Heidi and offspring Tyler, Harry, and Madison.
Playing career.
International honours.
Paul Morgan won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while with Bridgend Blue Bulls in the <a href="2005%20European%20Nations%20Cup">2005 European Nations Cup</a> against Ireland (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>), and France (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>).
Club career.
Paul Morgan made his début for <a href="Aberavon%20RFC">Aberavon RFC</a>, and scored two <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a>, against <a href="Walsall%20RFC">Walsall RFC</a> at <a href="Talbot%20Athletic%20Ground">Talbot Athletic Ground</a> on Sunday 20 August 2000, his last match for <a href="Aberavon%20RFC">Aberavon RFC</a> was against <a href="Neath%20RFC">Neath RFC</a> at <a href="The%20Gnoll">The Gnoll</a> on Wednesday 15 September 2004, he scored three <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> for <a href="Bridgend%20Blue%20Bulls">Bridgend Blue Bulls</a> in the 60–10 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Akkies">Leeds Akkies</a> in the 2005 <a href="Harry%20Jepson%20Trophy">Harry Jepson Trophy</a> at <a href="Brewery%20Field">Brewery Field</a> on Sunday 28 August 2005.
